rules.description: An SBOL document MUST declare the use of the following XML namespace: “http://sbols.org/v2#”.
An SBOL document MUST declare the use of the following XML namespace: “http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#”.
If an SBOL document includes any name or description properties,then it MUST declare the use of the following XML namespace: “http://purl.org/dc/terms/”.
If an SBOL document includes any wasDerivedFrom properties, then it MUST declare the use of the following XML namespace: “http://www.w3.org/ns/prov#”.
The identity property of an Identified object is REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI that adheres to the syntax defined by: “http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax#about”
The identity property of an Identified object MUST be globally unique.
The persistentIdentity property of an Identified object is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a URI that MUST adhere to the syntax defined by: “http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax#about”
The displayId property of an Identified object is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a String that MUST be composed of only alphanumeric or underscore characters and MUST NOT begin with a digit.
The displayId property of an Identified object SHOULD be locally unique.
The version property of an Identified object is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a String that MUST be composed of only alphanumeric characters, underscores, hyphens, or periods and MUST begin with a digit.
The version property of an Identified object SHOULD follow the conventions of semantic versioning as implemented by Maven.
The wasDerivedFrom property of an Identified object is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a URI.
The wasDerivedFrom property of an Identified object MUST NOT contain a URI reference to the Identified object itself.
Identified objects MUST NOT form circular reference chains via their wasDerivedFrom properties.

If the wasDerivedFrom property of one Identified object refers to another Identified object with the same persistentIdentity property, then version property of the second Identified object MUST precede that of the first if both objects have a version.
The name property of an Identified object is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a String.
The description property of an Identified object is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a String.
The annotations property of an Identified object is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a set of Annotation objects.
The displayId property of a compliant Identified object is REQUIRED.
The persistentIdentity property of a compliant TopLevel object is REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI that ends with a delimiter (’/’, ’#’, or ’:’) followed by the displayId of the TopLevel object.

The persistentIdentity property of a compliant Identified object that is not also a TopLevel object is REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI that begins with the persistentIdentity of the compliant object’s parent and is immediately followed by a delimiter (’/’, ’#’, or ’:’) and the displayId of the compliant object.

If a compliant Identified object has no version property, then its identity property MUST contain the same URI as its persistentIdentity property. Otherwise, the compliant object’s identity property MUST contain a URI that begins with its persistentIdentity and is immediately followed by a delimiter (’/’, ’#’, or ’:’) and its version.
The version property of a compliant Identified object that is not also a TopLevel object is REQUIRED to contain the same String as the version property of the compliant object’s parent.
A TopLevel object MUST inherit all properties of the Identified class.
A Sequence MUST inherit all properties of the TopLevel class.
The elements property of a Sequence is REQUIRED and MUST contain a String.
The encoding property of Sequence is REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI.
The encoding property of a Sequence MUST indicate how the elements property of the Sequence is to be formed and interpreted.
The elements property of a Sequence MUST be consistent with its encoding property.
The encoding property of a Sequence MUST contain a URI from Table 1 if it is well-described by this URI.
A ComponentDefinition MUST inherit all properties of the TopLevel class.
The types property of a ComponentDefinition is REQUIRED and MUST contain a non-empty set of URIs.
The types property of a ComponentDefinition MUST NOT contain more than one URI from Table 2.

Each URI contained by the types property of a ComponentDefinition MUST refer to an ontology term that describes the category of biochemical or physical entity that is represented by the ComponentDefinition.
The types property of a ComponentDefinition MUST contain a URI from Table 2 if it is well-described by this URI.
All URIs contained by the types property of a ComponentDefinition MUST refer to non-conflicting ontology terms.
The roles property of a ComponentDefinition is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a set of URIs.
Each URI contained by the roles property of a ComponentDefinition MUST refer to an ontology term that clarifies the potential function of the ComponentDefinition in a biochemical or physical context.
Each URI contained by the roles property of a ComponentDefinition MUST refer to an ontology term that is consistent with its types property.
The roles property of a ComponentDefinition MUST contain a URI from Table 3 if it is well-described by this URI.
The roles property of a ComponentDefinition SHOULD only contain a URI provided in Table 3 if one of its types is cross-listed with this URI.
The sequences property of a ComponentDefinition is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a set of URIs.
Each URI contained by the sequences property of a ComponentDefinition MUST refer to a Sequence object.

The Sequence objects referred to by the sequences property of a ComponentDefinition MUST be consistent with each other, such that well-defined mappings exist between their elements properties in accordance with their encoding properties.
The sequences property of a ComponentDefinition MUST NOT refer to Sequence objects with conflicting encoding properties.

If the sequences property of a ComponentDefinition refers to one or more Sequence objects, and one of the types of this ComponentDefinition comes from Table 2, then one of the Sequence objects MUST have the encoding that is cross-listed with this type in Table 1.

If the sequences property of a ComponentDefinition refers to a Sequence with an encoding from Table 1, then the types property of the ComponentDefinition MUST contain the type from Table 2 that is cross-listed with this encoding in Table 1.
If a ComponentDefinition refers to more than one Sequence with the same encoding, then the elements of these Sequence objects SHOULD have equal lengths.
The components property of a ComponentDefinition is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a set of Component objects.

description: If a ComponentDefinition in a ComponentDefinition-Component hierarchy refers to one or more Sequence objects, and there exist ComponentDefinition objects lower in the hierarchy that refer to Sequence objects with the same encoding, then the elements properties of these Sequence objects SHOULD be consistent with each other, such that well-defined mappings exist from the “lower level” elements to the “higher level” elements in accordance with their shared encoding properties. This mapping is also subject to any restrictions on the positions of the Component objects in the hierarchy that are imposed by the SequenceAnnotation or SequenceConstraint objects contained by the ComponentDefinition objects in the hierarchy.
The sequenceAnnotations property of a ComponentDefinition is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a set of SequenceAnnotation objects.
The sequenceAnnotations property of a ComponentDefinition MUST NOT contain two or more SequenceAnnotation objects that refer to the same Component.

If the sequences property of a ComponentDefinition refers to a Sequence with an IUPAC encoding from Table 1, then each SequenceAnnotation that includes a Range and/or Cut in the sequenceAnnotations property of the ComponentDefinition SHOULD specify a region on the elements of this Sequence.
The sequenceConstraints property of a ComponentDefinition is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a set of SequenceConstraint objects.
A ComponentInstance MUST inherit all properties of the Identified class.
The definition property of a ComponentInstance is REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI.
The definition property of a ComponentInstance MUST NOT contain a URI reference to the ComponentDefinition that contains the ComponentInstance.
The URI contained by the definition property MUST refer to a ComponentDefinition object.
ComponentInstance objects MUST NOT form circular reference chains via their definition properties and parent ComponentDefinition objects.
The mapsTos property of a ComponentInstance is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a set of MapsTo objects.
The access property of a ComponentInstance is REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI from Table4.
A Component MUST inherit all properties of the ComponentInstance class.
A MapsTo MUST inherit all properties of the Identified class.
The local property of a MapsTo is REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI.
If a MapsTo is contained by a Component in a ComponentDefinition, then the local property of the MapsTo MUST refer to another Component in the ComponentDefinition.
If a MapsTo is contained by a FunctionalComponent or Module in a ModuleDefinition, then the local property of the MapsTo MUST refer to another FunctionalComponent in the ModuleDefinition.
The remote property of a MapsTo is REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI.
The remote property of a MapsTo MUST refer to a ComponentInstance.
The ComponentInstance referred to by the remote property of a MapsTo MUST have an access property that contains the URI http://sbols.org/v2#public.

If a MapsTo is contained by a ComponentInstance, then the remote property of the MapsTo MUST refer to a Component in the ComponentDefinition that is referenced by the definition property of the ComponentInstance.
If a MapsTo is contained by a Module, then the remote property of the MapsTo MUST refer to a FunctionalComponent in the ModuleDefinition that is referenced by the definition property of the Module.
The refinement property of a MapsTo is REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI from Table 5. Reference: Section 7.7.3 on page 26.

If the refinement property of a MapsTo contains the URI http://sbols.org/v2#verifyIdentical , then the ComponentInstance objects referred to by local and remote properties of the MapsTo MUST refer to the same ComponentDefinition via their definition properties.
A SequenceAnnotation MUST inherit all properties of the Identified class.
The locations property of a SequenceAnnotation is REQUIRED and MUST contain a non- empty set of Location objects.
The Location objects contained by the locations property of a single SequenceAnnotation SHOULD NOT specify overlapping regions.
The component property is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a URI reference to a Component.
The Component referenced by the component property of a SequenceAnnotation MUST be contained by the ComponentDefinition that contains the SequenceAnnotation.
A Location MUST inherit all properties of the Identified class.
The orientation property of a Location is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a URI from Table 6.
A Range MUST inherit all properties of the Location class.
The start property of a Range is REQUIRED and MUST contain an Integer greater than zero.
The end property of a Range is REQUIRED and MUST contain an Integer greater than zero.
The value of the end property of a Range MUST be greater than or equal to the value of its start property.
A Cut MUST inherit all properties of the Location class.
The at property is REQUIRED and MUST contain an Integer greater than or equal to zero.
A GenericLocation MUST inherit all properties of the Location class.
A SequenceConstraint MUST inherit all properties of the Identified class.
The subject property is REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI reference to a Component.
The Component referenced by the subject property of a SequenceConstraint MUST be contained by the ComponentDefinition that contains the SequenceConstraint.
The object property is REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI reference to a Component.
The Component referenced by the object property of a SequenceConstraint MUST be contained by the ComponentDefinition that contains the SequenceConstraint.
The object property of a SequenceConstraint MUST NOT refer to the same Component as the subject property of the SequenceConstraint.
The restriction property is REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI.

The URI contained by the restriction property of a SequenceConstraint MUST indicate the type of structural restriction on the relative, sequence-based positions or orientations of the Component objects referred to by the subject and object properties of the SequenceConstraint.

If the restriction property of a SequenceConstraint contains the URI http://sbols.org/v2#precedes, then the position of the Component referred to by the subject property of the SequenceConstraint MUST precede that of the Component referred to by its object property.

If the restriction property of a SequenceConstraint contains the URI http://sbols.org/v2#sameOrientationAs, then the orientation of the Component referred to by the subject property of the SequenceConstraint MUST be the same as that of the Component referred to by its object property.

If the restriction property of a SequenceConstraint contains the URI http://sbols.org/v2#oppositeOrientationAs, then the orientation of the Component referred to by the subject property of the SequenceConstraint MUST be opposite that of the Component referred to by its object property.
The URI contained by the restriction property SHOULD come from Table 7.
A Model MUST inherit all properties of the TopLevel class.
The source property is a REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI.
The URI contained by the source property of a Model MUST specify the location of the model’s source file.
The language property is REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI.
The URI contained by the language property of a Model MUST specify the language in which the model is encoded.
The language property of a Model MUST contain a URI from Table 8 if it is well-described by this URI.
The language property of a Model SHOULD contain a URI that refers to a term from the EDAM ontology.
The framework property is REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI.
The URI contained by the framework property of a Model MUST specify the modeling framework of the model.
The framework property of a Model MUST contain a URI from Table 9 if it is well-described by this URI.
The framework property SHOULD contain a URI that refers to a term from the modeling framework branch of the SBO.
A ModuleDefinition MUST inherit all properties of the TopLevel class.
The roles property is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a set of URIs.
Each URI contained by roles property of a ModuleDefinition MUST refer to a resource that clarifies the intended function of the ModuleDefinition.
The modules property OPTIONAL and MAY contain a set of Module objects.
The interactions property is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a set of Interaction objects.
The functionalComponents property is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a set of FunctionalComponent objects.
The models property is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a set of URIs.
Each URI contained by the models property of a ModuleDefinition MUST refer to a Model.
A Module MUST inherit all properties of the Identified class.
The definition property of a Module is REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI.
The URI contained by the definition property of Module MUST refer to a ModuleDefinition.
The definition property of a Module MUST NOT contain a URI reference to the ModuleDefinition that contains the Module.
Module objects MUST NOT form circular reference chains via their definition properties and parent ModuleDefinition objects.
The mapsTos property is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a set of MapsTo objects.
A FunctionalComponent MUST inherit all properties of the ComponentInstance class.
The direction property of a FunctionalComponent is REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI from Table 10.
An Interaction MUST inherit all properties of the Identified class.
The types property of an Interaction is REQUIRED and MUST contain a non-empty set of URIs.
Each URI contained by the types property of an Interaction MUST refer to an ontology term that describes the behavior represented by the Interaction.
All URIs contained by the types property of an Interaction MUST refer to non-conflicting ontology terms.
A least one URI contained by the types property of an Interaction SHOULD refer to a term from the occurring entity relationship branch of the SBO.
The participations property of an Interaction is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a set of Participation objects.
A Participation MUST inherit all properties of the Identified class.
The participant property of a Participation is REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI reference to a FunctionalComponent.
The FunctionalComponent referenced by the participant property of a Participation MUST be contained by the ModuleDefinition that contains the Interaction which contains the Participation.
The roles property of an Participation is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a set of URIs.
Each URI contained by the roles property of an Participation MUST refer to an ontology term that describes the behavior represented by the Participation.
All URIs contained by the roles property of an Participation MUST refer to non-conflicting ontology terms.
A least one role in the set of roles SHOULD be a URI from the participant role branch of the SBO.
A Collection MUST inherit all properties of the TopLevel class.
The members property of a Collection is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a set of URIs.
Each URI contained by the members property of a Collection MUST reference a TopLevel object.
The name property of an Annotation is REQUIRED and MUST contain a QName.
The value property of an Annotation is REQUIRED and MUST contain an AnnotationValue.
An AnnotationValue MUST be a literal (a String, Integer, Double, or Boolean), URI, or a NestedAnnotations object.
The nestedQName property of a NestedAnnotations object is REQUIRED and MUST contain a QName.
The nestedURI property of a NestedAnnotations object is REQUIRED and MUST contain a URI.
The annotations property of a NestedAnnotations object is OPTIONAL and MAY contain a set of Annotation objects.
A GenericTopLevel object MUST inherit all properties of the TopLevel class.
The rdfType property of a GenericTopLevel object is REQUIRED and MUST contain a QName.
